intro: Dombeya marojejyensis, commonly known as the Marojejy dombeya, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, thriving in the humid climate of its endemic habitat. Its leaves are simple and ovate, often with a hairy texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
